slides.title: Docker Containers
slides.content:
# Docker Containers ğŸ³

Package services consistently.

## Dockerfile:
```dockerfile
FROM node:18-alpine
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci --only=production
COPY . .
EXPOSE 3000
CMD ["node", "server.js"]
```

## Build & Run:
```bash
docker build -t user-service:1.0 .
docker run -p 3000:3000 user-service:1.0
```

## Benefits:
- Consistent environments
- Isolation
- Portability
- Versioned images

## Deployment:
```yaml
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: user-service
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: user
  template:
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: user
          image: user-service:1.0
          ports:
            - containerPort: 3000
```

slides.title: Kubernetes Services
slides.content:
# Kubernetes Services ğŸ”—

Networking for pods.

## Service Types:
```yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: user-service
spec:
  type: ClusterIP  # Internal
  selector:
    app: user
  ports:
    - port: 80
      targetPort: 3000
```

## Types:
| Type | Scope |
|------|-------|
| ClusterIP | Internal only |
| NodePort | External on node port |
| LoadBalancer | External with LB |
| Ingress | HTTP routing |

slides.title: Deployment Strategies
slides.content:
# Deployment Strategies ğŸ“‹

## Blue-Green:
```
Blue (current) â”€â”€â–º Switch â”€â”€â–º Green (new)
All traffic moves at once
```

## Canary:
```
v1: 90% traffic
v2: 10% traffic (canary)
     â†“ gradually increase
v2: 100% traffic
```

## Rolling:
```
Replace pods one at a time
Zero downtime
```

## Comparison:
| Strategy | Risk | Rollback |
|----------|------|----------|
| Blue-Green | Low | Instant |
| Canary | Lowest | Fast |
| Rolling | Medium | Slower |
